resources.string:
Senior Choir Practice.........................................5:00-6:30PM
1st Friday Monthly Tarry...............................5:00 - 9:00PM
2nd and 5th Fridays 
Healing and Deliverance Services 12:00 Noon
*To be lead by the choir and organist
Friends youâ€™re welcome to worship with us today, feel at home as you worship with us, we appreciate your coming, may the Lord richly bless you, we hope you come again..
Happy birthday to you, may God richly bless you, may your christian light be seen, may your christian light be seen, happy birthday to you..
Happy birthday to you, may your love and beauty shine, may grace and peace and love abound, may prayers and services be around, happy birthday to you.
We give thee all thine own, what ever the gift may be, All that we have is thine alone, A trust, O Lord, from thee... All that we have is thine alone, A trust, O Lord, from thee, Amen
Let us unite in the historic confession of the christian faith

I believe in God, the Father Almighty, creator of heaven and earth.

I believe in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, died, and was buried; he descended to the dead. On the third day he rose again; he ascended into heaven, is seated at the right hand of the Father, and will come again to judge the living and the dead.
 
I believe in the Holy Spirit, the holy christian church, the communion of saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and the life everlasting. 

Amen.
Prayer of Illumination and Reading of the word of God
O Lord, give us retentive minds to listen and obey your word as it is read and preach to us through the power of your Holy Spirit, Amen.

Today worship service reminds us that we have experience the transforming spirit of God by fellowshipping, singing songs, praying, giving our gifts, hearing the scriptures, and the message, We are called upon, to go to our different communities and the nation as renewed people as we witness for christ through love, joy, peace and hope.

We go from this place of worship as transformed people to reach all races, the unreachable, the sick, the needy, the rich, the poor, the children, the abused, the physically challenged in the name of Jesus Christ.
Presented for the glory of God by father Adolphus M. Johnson in honor of Mother Decontee Gbah
We lift them up to the Lord.
Let us give thanks to the Lord our God.
It is right to give our thanks and praise.

Father, It is right that we should always and everywhere give you thanks and praise, Only you are God. You created all things and called them good. You made us in your own image. Even though we rebelled against your love, you did not desert us. You delivered us from captivity, made covenant to be our sovereign God, and spoke to us through the prophets. \nTherefore we join the entire company of heaven and all our people on earth in worshipping and glorifying you;
Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might, heaven and earth are full of your glory. Hosanna in the highest. Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord. Hosanna in the highest.

We thank you holy Lord God, that you love the world so much, You send you only son to be our Savior. the Lord of all life came to live among us. He healed and taught, ate with sinners and won for you a new people by water and the Spirit. He healed the sick, fed the hungry, and ate with sinners and won for you a new people by water and the Spirit. We saw his glory. Yet he humble himself in obedience to you will, freely accepting death on the cross, by dying, he freed us from unending death; by rising from the death, he gave us everlasting life, On the night in which he gave himself up for us, the Lord Jesus took bread, After giving thanks, he broke the bread, gave it to his disciples and said, Take, eat, this is my body which is given for you. When the supper was over, he took the cup, Again he return thanks to you, gave the cup to his disciples, and said: Drink from this, all of you; this is my cup of the new covenant in my blood, poured out for you and for many for the forgiveness of sins. When we eat this bread and drink this cup, we experience a new, the presence of the Lord Jesus Christ and look forward to his coming in final victory
Christ has died, Christ is risen, Christ will come again.

Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as in heaven. Give us today our daily bread. Forgive us our sins as we forgive those who sin against us. Save us from the time of trial, and deliver us from evil. For the kingdom, the power, and the glory are yours now and for ever.
Amen.

BREAKING THE BREAD 
 
The Minister breaks the bread in silence, or while saying: Because there is one loaf, we, many as we are are one body, For it is one loaf of which we all partake when we break the bread, Is it not the shearing in the body of Christ? 
 
The Minister lifts up the cup in silence, or while saying: When we give thanks over the cup, is it not a sharing in the blood of Christ?
THE BODY OF CHRIST, GIVEN FOR YOU. AMEN \nTHE BLOOD OF CHRIST, GIVEN FOR YOU. AMEN
The congregation sing hymns. \n\nPRAYER AFTER COMMUNION

You have given yourself to us, Lord 

 *Now we give ourselves for others 

Your love has made us a mew people: 

 *As a people of love we will serve you with joy 

Your glory has filled our hearts: 

 *Help us to glorify you in all things.
Amen 

DISMISSAL WITH BLESSING

Go in peace to serve God and your neighbor in all that you do 
 
 *We are sent in Christ name 

The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all 

 *Amen.
